target_name: 2030년까지 후천성면역결핍증(AIDS), 결핵, 말라리아 및 소외열대질환의 확산을 종식시키고 간염, 수인성 질병 및 기타 전염성 질병 방지

en.target: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
en.title: Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases
en.indicator_name: Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases
en.global_metadata_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (PDF 390 KB)
en.graph_title: Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases
en.source_url_text_1: Laboratory-confirmed cases of chikungunya by region of travel, England, Wales and Northern Ireland - 2009 to 2014
en.source_other_info_1: Data provided by the Rare and Imported Pathogens Laboratory, PHE Centre for Emergency Preparedness and Reponse, Porton Down. Note that the totals in the table are higher than the total number of cases stated in the report as some cases travelled to more than one country. All possible travel destinations are included for analysis if no dates of travel or onset have been stated; in reality a case is likely to have acquired his/her infection in only one country.
en.source_url_text_2: Confirmed cases of dengue fever by region of travel, England, Wales and Northern Ireland - 2009 to 2014
en.source_other_info_2: Data provided by the Rare and Imported Pathogens Laboratory, PHE Porton and collated by the Travel and Migrant Health Section.
en.page_content: ▶ Data type: National data (Type1) This is the national produced statistics in the ROK that best corresponds to the definition of UN SDGs indicators. Download the national metadata file for more information.
